alert.note: Alert for Central Chaffee County Below 9000 Ft; Eastern Sawatch Mountains above 11000 Ft; Western Chaffee County Between 9000 and 11000 Ft; Western Mosquito Range, East Chaffee County above 9000Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 2:24PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms with locally heavy rain will impact portions of northern Chaffee County through 245 PM MDT... At 219 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Buena Vista to near Cottonwood Pass. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. There could be torrential rainfall with these storms which could eventually produce flash flooding over the Cottonwood Creek area. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Buena Vista, Trout Creek Pass and St Elmo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Chaffee County Below 9000 Ft; Eastern Sawatch Mountains above 11000 Ft; Western Chaffee County Between 9000 and 11000 Ft; Western Mosquito Range, East Chaffee County above 9000Ft
